GSD.product_version: versions from v4.15 to before v6.0.3
GSD.description:
net: thunderbolt: Enable DMA paths only after rings are enabled

This is an automated ID intended to aid in discovery of potential security vulnerabilities. The actual impact and attack plausibility have not yet been proven.
This ID is fixed in Linux Kernel version v6.0.3 by commit 53f15e731f0a4842177a1741a6e9c4a5ad4580ad, it was introduced in version v4.15 by commit e69b6c02b4c3b8d03be7136f90dd9551ad5a5a5e. For more details please see the references link.

OSV.summary: net: thunderbolt: Enable DMA paths only after rings are enabled
